greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of distinct vertices in the set-system with BII-number n.
comment: A binary index of n is any position of a 1 in its reversed binary expansion. We define the set-system with BII-number n to be obtained by taking the binary indices of each binary index of n. For example, 18 has reversed binary expansion (0,1,0,0,1), and since the binary indices of 2 and 5 are {2} and {1,3} respectively, the BII-number of {{2},{1,3}} is 18.
example: The BII-number of {{1,2},{1,4}} is 260, with distinct vertices {1,2,4}, so a(260) = 3.
xref: Positions of first appearances are A072639.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Jul 22 2019
